channel.title: D plate problem
channel.description:
I'm working with a PI base server, and the Dragon platebody arms are messed up. The clothes and arms kinda poke through the armor, like this
[img]http://i53.tinypic.com/1441k3s.jpg[/img]
how do I fix this, the model Id is listed under the body and platebody parts of the items java file, so i doubt it's that
also, how would I recolour models in a pi server without a class8 or models to directly recolour?

item.title: D plate problem
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

you have to add the chestplate id in item.java serversided in

public int[] platebodies = {

public int{} bodies = {

Read full topic

ffs dont post if u dnt know what youre talking about, its source sided

item.title: D plate problem
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

bigbaddrag:

the thing is, I can’t find the int’s for the items, there’s no class8 and it isn’t in items.cfg so idk where to look, since I’m only working on it, and didn’t download it myself, so I don’t know much about locations of things

If you don’ t have a class8, then you will have to use renamed ints within the ItemDef class.

Read full topic

item.title: D plate problem
item.dc:creator: @dutchboy dutchboy
item.description:
@dutchboy wrote:

ok dnt look at idiot replies, all you need to do is add it to the body’s and platebody’s arrays in item.java

item.title: D plate problem
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

It also kind of looks like the model is resting too far down the characters body, because the neck seems really long and that would explain the arms glitching. You may have incorrect ints.

Read full topic

item.title: D plate problem
item.dc:creator: @bigbaddrag bigbaddrag
item.description:
@bigbaddrag wrote:

Sanskrit:

I think that the model you are using is 508+, the character arm models are different for the higher revisions. To recolor models, get a model editing program and import the item you want to recolor, then do it from there.

i know how to work with models, as long as i have the actual models, but i couldn’t find models anywhere in the files I have, and this may be a 508+, since it looks too good to be 317. But I was told that it was a PI, unless I’m hearing things… or reading things wrong i guess.

And yes, it does go to the correct slot

Read full topic

item.title: D plate problem
